title: How do I change the minimum scroll amount? Scrolling is choppy in firefox for Linux vs Windows on same computer.
content:
Hey there I am a long time Firefox user, and a new Ubuntu user. Dual booting Ubuntu & Windows on a single laptop. When I use the touchpad to scroll on Firefox in Ubuntu, the scroll behavior automatically jumps several lines at a time, instead of a smooth, fine adjustment that I get everywhere else. The scrolling on the rest of Ubuntu doesn't jump lines like this, and on the fresh Windows install I just did, the scrolling is smooth, fine, and normal as well. Even when I use autoscroll on Firefox in Ubuntu, the scrolling is smooth and infinitely/finely adjustable/normal.

I have played with all of the settings that contain the word "scroll" in about:config to no avail. I have been able to make the scrolling less jarring by turning on and adjusting the scrolling physics options, But it's still a workaround because I can't just scroll a hair if I want to. I essentially just slowed the "spring weight" and acceleration action down. Changing "mousewheel.system_scroll_override.enabled" to "false" made the minimum scroll distance less by a couple of lines. But did not get rid of it; Still, the minimum amount I can scroll up or down is several lines.

How do I change this? Is there a setting that I am unaware of?

Thanks!!
creator: supertown07

title: no dark mode, win 11
content: Where is the dark mode toggle? I can find it no where. I'm going to uninstall.

title: Populating shortcut boxes
content: I just "refreshed" my Firefox so all my shortcuts to sites I visit regularly are gone and I have to start over. It's not working...I click on an empty shortcut box and I'm taken to another screen where I enter the site name and URL...click "add"...and nothing happens. Tried it 3 times and...nothing.

title: The proxy server is refusing connections
content:
Hi, I have been trying to use Firefox for months, I have selected No Proxy and followed all your instructions, however, I continue to receive the same message - The proxy server is refusing connections

Could you please assist?

Thank you

title: CALIDAD DE IMPRESION EN LA VERSION ACTUAL Y VERSION 80.0.1 (sigue con el mismo problema)
content:
Estamos realizando pruebas de impresion con la version actual para comprobantes electronicos en un un formato ticket 80mm y la version 80.0.1 comprobamos que la version actual no cuenta con buena calidad de impresion a diferencia de la version anterior 80.0.1.

Adjuntamos imagenes para que se pueda validar el caso. Capturas de pantalla adjuntas

title: browser keeps crash
content: Firefox has not worked properly for the past two days. Keeps crashing either on start up or shortly after I visit a website. Browser turns into a white rectangle and them my entire screen goes black. So far all troubleshooting solutions suggested by this website have not worked.

title: Import from another browser: Firefox ESR
content:
I've been using Firefox ESR (). I want to change to Firefox.

When I run Firefox, go to the File Menu, and select Import From Another Browser it tells me that no programs that contain bookmarks, history, or password data could be found.

I have not uninstalled Firefox ESR, it contains bookmarks, history, or password data.

Why can't Firefox find Firefox ESR? How do I make this import happen?
creator: hatta00

title: Firefox closes unless I rename the executable
content: Firefox instantly closes whenever I run it, unless I rename the executable to something other than "firefox.exe". This is a problem, because windows doesn't recognize it as a browser otherwise, so I cannot set it to my default browser.

title: Google Is Killing Firefox Browser
content:
Google with Captcha is killing Firefox.

Captcha constantly comes up in Firefox and stalls browsing.

Not as much of an issue with Google Chrome.

Often stuck for ages entering Captcha nonsense in Forefox.

What can Firefox people do about this crap?
creator: oznewmedia

title: Font rendering configurations are not being applied after new update.
content:
I tweaked my Firefox configs to get better font rendering because I hate how "skinny" they are by default on windows. The options changed are:

  • gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.rendering_mode to 5
  • gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.force_gdi_classic_for_families to ""
  • gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.enhanced_contrast to 100
  • gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.cleartype_level to 100
  • gfx.font_rendering.cleartype_params.pixel_structure to 1
  • gfx.webrender.quality.force-subpixel-aa-where-possible to true

After the update, the fonts are default again, and no matter how much I change the configs, it doesn't change anything.
creator: uvh8ozb6

title: Hulu Issues
content: If I open up Hulu in Firefox it never loads the title cards or let me click on any videos in the website. I have turned my adblocker on and off and even uninstalled it at one point but I cannot get the issue to go away. Upon opening the browser console I found that the site has a source map error as shown in the attached image. Im not sure how to fix this as google hasnt been much help so far.
